<input id="searchbox" placeholder="How do I ... ?">
<div id="hits"></div>

<!-- Use Lunr.js as the search library -->
<script src="https://unpkg.com/lunr/lunr.js"></script>

<script type="text/javascript">
// Fetch the generated Algolia search index
const SEARCH_INDEX_URL = 'search.json';

// Function to load search.json file and return it as a JavaScript object
async function loadSearchIndex() {
    const response = await fetch(SEARCH_INDEX_URL);
    const searchData = await response.json();
    return searchData;
}

// Function to initialize Lunr.js and index your documents for searching
async function setupLunr() {
    const searchData = await loadSearchIndex();

    // Create Lunr.js index
    const idx = lunr(function () {
        // Define the fields to index
        this.ref('href');
        this.field('title');
        this.field('content');

        // Add each document from searchData to the index
        searchData.forEach(function (doc) {
            this.add(doc);
        }, this);
    });

    return { idx, searchData };
}

// Clear the search input when the page loads
window.onload = function() {
    document.getElementById('searchbox').value = '';  // Clear the search box input
};

// Call setupLunr to initialize the search index and prepare it for queries
setupLunr().then(({ idx, searchData }) => {
    document.getElementById('searchbox').addEventListener('input', function (event) {
        const query = event.target.value.trim();  // Trim any extra spaces
        const hitsContainer = document.getElementById('hits');
        hitsContainer.innerHTML = '';  // Clear previous results

        // Check if the input is empty
        if (query === '') {
            hitsContainer.style.display = 'none';  // Hide the hits container if input is empty
            return;  // Exit the function early
        }

        const results = idx.search(query);

        if (results.length > 0) {
            hitsContainer.style.display = 'block';  // Show the hits container if there are results

            // Display all results
            results.forEach((result) => {
                const doc = searchData.find(d => d.href === result.ref);

                if (doc) {
                    const resultElement = document.createElement('div');
                    resultElement.innerHTML = `<a href="${doc.href}"><strong>${doc.title}</strong><br>${doc.text.substring(0, 100)}...</a>`;
                    hitsContainer.appendChild(resultElement);
                }
            });
        } else {
            hitsContainer.style.display = 'none';  // Hide the hits container if no results
        }
    });
});

</script>
